channels.summary: Ongoing discussion about practical SEO tactics: building backlinks without budget through valuable content, structuring sites (including blogs and multi-language pages), and using hub-based internal linking to strengthen key pages.

highlights.title: Using valuable, shareable content and Reddit to earn natural backlinks
highlights.details: ph1l explains that without budget, SEO should focus on creating high-value, shareable content that users naturally talk about and link to. They suggest leveraging Reddit and building a fanbase to generate organic backlinks rather than chasing abstract metrics like 'authority.'

highlights.title: Applying a HUB strategy to strengthen important pages
highlights.details: Hamza recommends a HUB strategy for site structure: organizing related content around key hub pages to boost their authority, keep content fresh, and improve indexability, especially for tools or service-based websites.

highlights.title: Scaling multi-language pages and indexing
highlights.details: Mateusz discusses finishing and indexing multiple language versions of pages to see how much traffic impact this internationalization effort will have.

channels.summary: Light general chat plus an invite to a session on rapidly improving brand visibility in AI search results using a researched playbook and the Spotlight tool.

highlights.title: Playbook to grow brand visibility in AI results from 0% to 20% in 2 weeks
highlights.details: Michael shares that after a year of research across millions of prompt responses for 1000+ brands, he has a proven playbook for rapidly increasing brand visibility in AI-generated answers. He invites members to a session on doing this with free tools and how Spotlight can automate parts of the process.

channels.summary: Brief updates about AI tooling: a new project to showcase founders' AI stacks and a shared X/Twitter post related to AI.

highlights.title: AI Stack â€“ showcasing how founders use AI tools
highlights.details: Alper is building a project called AI Stack with a landing page that aims to share how different founders use their AI tools, enabling others to learn from real-world AI workflows.

highlights.title: Shared AI-related X/Twitter post
highlights.details: Bhavya shares an X/Twitter status link; the specific content isn't described in the message but is likely AI-related given the channel context.
